intro: Soehrensia uebelmanniana, commonly known as the Uebelmann's sandthorn, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and spiny stems. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces fruit that contains seeds enclosed in a fleshy, yellowish pericarp. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
